sn12.33:4.2: “Mendicants, I will teach forty-four grounds for knowledge. Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
sn12.33:5.1: “And what are the forty-four grounds for knowledge?
sn12.33:5.2: Knowledge of old age and death, knowledge of the origin of old age and death, knowledge of the cessation of old age and death, and knowledge of the practice that leads to the cessation of old age and death.
sn12.33:5.9: Knowledge of the six sense fields …
sn12.33:5.12: Knowledge of choices, knowledge of the origin of choices, knowledge of the cessation of choices, and knowledge of the practice that leads to the cessation of choices.
sn12.33:5.13: These are called the forty-four grounds for knowledge.
sn12.33:6.1: And what is old age and death?
sn12.33:6.2: The old age, decrepitude, broken teeth, grey hair, wrinkly skin, diminished vitality, and failing faculties of the various sentient beings in the various orders of sentient beings. This is called old age.
sn12.33:6.3: The passing away, perishing, disintegration, demise, mortality, death, decease, breaking up of the aggregates, and laying to rest of the corpse of the various sentient beings in the various orders of sentient beings.
sn12.33:6.5: Such is old age, and such is death.
sn12.33:6.6: This is called old age and death.
sn12.33:7.1: Rebirth is the origin of old age and death.
sn12.33:7.2: When rebirth ceases, old and age and death cease.
sn12.33:7.3: The practice that leads to the cessation of sensual pleasures is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
sn12.33:7.4: right view, right motivation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right samādhi.
sn12.33:8.1: A noble disciple understands old age and death, their origin, their cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation. This is their knowledge of the present phenomenon.
sn12.33:8.2: With this present phenomenon that is seen, known, immediate, attained, and fathomed, they infer to the past and future.
sn12.33:9.1: Whatever ascetics and brahmins in the past directly knew old age and death, their origin, their cessation, and the practice leading to their cessation, all of them directly knew these things in exactly the same way that I do now.
sn12.33:10.1: Whatever ascetics and brahmins in the future will directly know old age and death, their origin, their cessation, and the practice leading to their cessation, all of them will directly know these things in exactly the same way that I do now.
sn12.33:10.2: This is their knowledge of what follows.
sn12.33:11.1: A noble disciple has purified and cleansed these two knowledges—
sn12.33:11.2: knowledge of the present phenomena, and knowledge of what follows.
sn12.33:11.3: When a noble disciple has done this, they’re called ‘one accomplished in view’, ‘one accomplished in vision’, ‘one who has come to the true teaching’, ‘one who sees this true teaching’, ‘one endowed with a trainee’s knowledge’, ‘one who has entered the stream of the teaching’, ‘a noble one with penetrative vision’, and ‘one who stands knocking at the door of the deathless’.
sn12.33:12.7: And what are the six sense fields? …
sn12.33:12.8: And what are name and form? …
sn12.33:12.11: There are three kinds of choices.
sn12.33:12.12: Choices by way of body, speech, and mind.
sn12.33:13.1: Ignorance is the origin of choices.
sn12.33:13.3: The practice that leads to the cessation of sensual pleasures is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
sn12.33:13.4: right view, right motivation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right samādhi.
sn12.33:14.1: A noble disciple understands old age and death, their origin, their cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation. This is their knowledge of the present phenomenon.
sn12.33:14.2: With this present phenomenon that is seen, known, immediate, attained, and fathomed, they infer to the past and future.
sn12.33:15.1: Whatever ascetics and brahmins in the past directly knew old age and death, their origin, their cessation, and the practice leading to their cessation, all of them directly knew these things in exactly the same way that I do now.

sn12.33:16.2: This is their knowledge of what follows.
sn12.33:17.1: A noble disciple has purified and cleansed these two knowledges—
sn12.33:17.2: knowledge of the present phenomena, and knowledge of what follows.
sn12.33:17.3: When a noble disciple has done this, they’re called ‘one accomplished in view’, ‘one accomplished in vision’, ‘one who has come to the true teaching’, ‘one who sees this true teaching’, ‘one endowed with a trainee’s knowledge’, ‘one who has entered the stream of the teaching’, ‘a noble one with penetrative vision’, and ‘one who stands knocking at the door of the deathless’.”
